body: I'll greatly appreciate any advice on where to look in the code to try and contribute a fix for this issue. I'm not familiar with webpack codebase at all.

@faergeek Thank you for your feedback. Maybe we need to add "await" here at [2], just like we did at [1], to make the code run properly. https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/main/lib/dependencies/HarmonyAcceptDependency.js#L85

@xiaoxiaojx yes, thank you üëç Looks like that's what needs to be done. I'm looking into it right now. I guess a piece similar to this https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/d5074201cf04423b5ebf2fa8ea1d66c40cf88b11/lib/async-modules/AwaitDependenciesInitFragment.js#L48-L69

needs to be added here https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/d5074201cf04423b5ebf2fa8ea1d66c40cf88b11/lib/RuntimeTemplate.js#L885

Or it should be similar to how defer is handled a little bit above it https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/d5074201cf04423b5ebf2fa8ea1d66c40cf88b11/lib/RuntimeTemplate.js#L875-L884

I'll experiment with it, but honestly I have no idea how to properly structure the code to open a PR yet.

issue.title: fix: await async dependencies when accepting them during HMR

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.body:
Fixes #19731

Avoid leaving a module wrapped in a Promise after accepting an update to an async dependency.

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?**

bugfix

**Did you add tests for your changes?**

Yes

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?**

No

**What needs to be documented once your changes are merged?**

Nothing

body: Fixed by https://github.com/webpack/webpack/pull/19741/, @faergeek feel free to feedback

body: @alexander-akait #19741 doesn't fix this issue itself, it fixes tests not passing on node@10, blocking #19744
@faergeek Yeah, my mistake, merged in the wrong order
